item.title: Latuii on Working with Pain
item.dc:creator: jeremy
item.content:encoded:
Introduction

Latuii is a fifth density social memory complex, typically a constituent of the Q'uo principle and before then in frequent contact with L/L Research. They speak on the subject of pain, especially bodily pain, and the ways to which it might be related on the seeker's path, both as recipient and as witness of another's pain. They suggest the most efficient use of pain involves feeling it deeply, and they encourage the friends of the afflicted to open themselves as well to this pain and provide company for the journey. Commentary is also provided on drugs, working with addiction and pain through thought forms, and offering ideas for meditation with a playfulness that will be recognized by the other self.

Group question

Please share thoughts on those who suffer from intense pain, as well as those who seek to serve those in pain. 

Channeled message

(Jeremy channeling)

I am Latuii. I am with this instrument. Greetings, my friends. We come today as your brothers and sisters who have at times marveled at the Creator's beauty and, at other times, have found the humor that rounds out the Creator's love. And we greet you in that sacred balance, that tension that denotes the contours of the Creator's face in each of our lives, how we transmit what love and beauty we can find into each other's lives. 

It is our first time with this instrument in a speaking capacity, and he is advised to keep steady and to continue reaching out in a challenge should he have any doubts as to our purposes this afternoon. However, we are confident that he has made the call, as have all of you in your hearts, and as our brothers and sisters of Hatonn have related recently,1 we come when there is a calling. We come when we feel that the face of the Creator may be brushed up against in just such a way, that the color of this visage can be appreciated in just the right manner, that a kind of resolution may occur, and the facets of the Creator that tend to hide in obscurity, but that can offer a new angle of viewing, might be drawn out. 

We are so pleased to be with you, for you are making such strides as a circle, and it is not possible, you see, for us to be able to contact you without this progress. There are other circles where we are an easier match, so to speak, and this is no shade, shall we say, on your project here. There is room for many different circles with many different emphases, for you seek to live lives of meaning and service, as do we; and to come when we are not called, when we do not have anything to offer, is to dazzle and entertain rather than commune, and we are all of us too busy for that, are we not? 

Please, in this case apply an extra dose of discernment to the ingestion of the words we offer. They are words, my friends, and they come from a place, a quality of balance that you may partake of if you are careful and ruthless, in a way, with your own humility. Certain portions of our message may not land where we would have them, for we in our state as a social memory complex distant from your planet-—despite all of our abilities to see into each other's hearts—still, my friends, cannot know for certain what will serve and what will detract from a life lived in love. Since this is our ultimate shared goal between you of this circle and we of the circle of Latuii, we must keep our purposes in mind and interpret these clumsy words through this veil of separation. 

Thank you for discarding any of our thoughts that you find inappropriate or disturbing, for though we are wont to conceive of ourselves as a light-hearted and merry fifth density complex, always seeking to be playful in ascertaining that upward spiraling light we seek together, nevertheless our lessons have been situated in the light of wisdom, and there is no shame in blocking light that blinds instead of illuminates. This is your task to accomplish: to find the way to relate to our words, even if that is a stepping away from the buffet and a departure, in part, from the love we offer you.

Before we begin our main monologue, let us take a moment as a circle, you of Earth and we of Latuii, to study, to center, and to appreciate our communion together. I am Latuii.

(Brief pause)

Again, my friends, we are those of Latuii, and we continue.

The subject for our dialogue with you today centers around pain. We note that the humor we are famous for has its roots in a squarely facing approach to pain. The reason for humor is to find in that which is difficult, that which is easily turned away from, the kernel of love that you express with the word, "absurdity." This experience of a Creator in separation from Itself, learning by rote and by the catalysis of balanced experience to grow towards an appreciation of its true nature: it is absurd. It was never possible, we believe, for the Creator to explore itself without an embrace of the energy of absurdity because this is a loving and positive way to feel into falsity that is marbled throughout your experience in the illusion. And therefore the pains that you have had in your life give you the entryway into the leavening, lightening force that humor is but one aspect of, and this is your healthy and balanced tool for relating to transformation in all of its discomforts, all of its tragedies. We would not downplay the pain of life. We would simply remark upon the moment of tension that allows one to recognize that the reality of pain does not obviate the reality of joy and love and comfort.

You see, much of what causes the imbalance towards pain beyond bearing is an inability to recall the nature of one's experience on a spectrum of affect. To feel pain is to make pleasure not only more brilliant but possible. And so our first observation of intense pain and the relating to the other self in this pain is one of recognizing the incompleteness of the experience. However overwhelming pain and suffering may be in your life, friends, it is only recognizable in contrast to that which you must acknowledge as possible. And indeed, this is largely that which in your third density experience—especially on this planet—frustrates so. 

This instrument remarked earlier on the exacerbation of pain due to a judgment by the self that it is wrong to feel it, and that when one is trapped in pain, truly one is trapped in a resistance to pain. Now, you will not hear those of Latuii encourage the acceptance of pain. It is possible, but it is a very blunt force way to relate to it. On some level, pain must be accepted when it is a friend in one's life because any rejection of life, of the subdivisions of the flow of life, is a rejection of life itself in a way and a retreat to the more unconscious and less sentient forms of creatorship that obtained in earlier densities from third. This is part of your heritage as mind/body/spirit complexes, and if you can appreciate this heritage—what it has conveyed to you as habits and strategies for the maintenance of a self-aware complex—then perhaps you can understand why an embrace of pain qua pain is not quite balanced.

Those of the complex of Ra offered a way to relate to emotions that has some applicability to the instances of pain that you experience in incarnative life: one of an express and purposeful balancing where a given emotion is seen, instead of as a totalizing experience, as a point on the line, a pole on the spectrum of possible experiences that have their root in the archetypal architecture of your experience.2 Pain is part of this architecture, for there must be some impetus to push and not simply to pull, to impel as a corollary to the drawing of evolution and progression. 

The problem, so to speak, enters in in a very special condition where there is a feeling of imprisonment in a given feeling, be it bodily, be it emotional, be it something much more subtle and hard to place the finger upon, such as pain arising from the spiritual complex portion of your beingness. We offer our condolences to those who feel disempowered and abandoned by their Creator as a result of this painful stasis, this inability to find solid ground off of which to push, for it hurts too much, or the hurt is so embedded in the memory of the self that one is rather arrested by this fear of feeling it again. Many who suffer from chronic bodily pain develop an antipathy towards leaving the painful condition in spite of their status as a co-Creator—not simply of their experience but of the universe—because it could always get worse, could it not? And one develops an antipathy and fear towards the way pain has seared itself into the consciousness.

Even the most bodily pain, my brothers and sisters, has a mental component, an emotional component, and a spiritual component. And it is most tragic in the spirit, because it is a closing off of the mystery that spirit transfers from Intelligent Infinity to the self. It is the dark night of the soul to be so trapped by fear, so incurious about the world outside of this prison of fear. The opposite of this case is that of the intrepid seeker who knows of the dangers on the path ahead, who is aware that pain will be on the menu; if not for this meal, then for some future meal. We caution you, therefore, to reflect deeply upon pains in your life and which behaviors they have prompted you to adopt. 

This is also important to face when it is a loved one who is in pain, for it can be challenging in the extreme not to take that pain upon oneself. We, in fact, would not suggest that one avoid this totally. What scares the mind/body/spirit complex in pain from risking further pain is experienced in the mind/body/spirit complex observing the one in pain. The discontent is felt on all sides because there is a recognition of an imbalance involved but a lack of avenues towards balance that seem workable: the one in pain afraid to risk further pain; the friend of the one in pain afraid to acknowledge the same possibility in their own experience. What is to be done in such a situation? 

We of Latuii are confused sometimes by the manner in which habitual thoughts and behaviors coalesce around these situations, for to us thoughts are things very expressly, and just as you might rearrange your room to imbue it with more tidiness, we arrange our thoughts to allow the energetic flow that typifies and certifies our balanced functioning. We simply excel at this compared to you for only one reason that speaks not to our superior capacities, but simply to our presence in an illusion in which we see the operation of our unconscious as a corollary to what we experience consciously. You, however, experience the unconscious less directly and as a buffeting breeze. A wind cannot be reasoned with; a gale-force wind must be yielded to if one seeks to maintain one's coherence. 

This is quite interesting to us because it speaks to the advantage of your illusion: that you must face these things, and that the arresting nature of pain only delays the healing. From our vantage point, this delay is entirely immaterial, for we operate at a different timescale, you see. You, on the other hand, not being privy to the elements of your total self that act as ballast to the ship of consciousness, must scramble about and think of some stratagem through which you may heal and recover mobility as the upward spiraling light draws you on. And you ask us, we hear, for input on these stratagems. 

We are loathe to offer advice, and instead would prefer to give you a better feel for the lay of the land, so to speak, so that you may pilot the ship in the unique way you are going to do, regardless of our words. We do not flatter ourselves so much as to consider your modes of inquiry inferior to ours. Indeed, while you stumble about a bit to be sure, each uncertain step has a consequentiality to it that we can only dream about. You have the opportunity to make so much progress compared to what is possible in our illusion, which is why the higher densities are so prevalent in the ranks of the wanderers: those who dip back into the dense illusion of third density to work out a tiny rough edge of their sculpture of spirit. 

Therefore, we would say that there is little advice to offer the one in truly abject pain. There is indeed the sense that there has been too much of a bad thing, which has the same effect as its inverse. This is not the fault, necessarily, of the seeker, but instead speaks to the unique logoic architecture in this sector, and as such the first takeaway in this study of pain is to honor it, and to perhaps not celebrate it, but to grant its power and presence in the life, whether you are its observer or its recipient. This will not provide a palliative immediately, but it will give the pain meaning. For if one can see that it wraps up within its harsh, spiky, groaning nature its own cure then one may consider after long struggle how patience may work with it. 

The pain, especially bodily pain, can be endured in almost every case. This is part of the problem. If it were unendurable, it would impel the seeker to seek all the more fervently, and this indeed is part of its purpose that has been perverted and lost in the confusion of third density. So one can simply be with the pain to great profit, and let it work instead of struggling against it. This would require in him who has suffered long a deep and overwhelming courage because often once pain and the catalyst it represents has grown to this level, it's going to get worse before it gets better, and this is the accurate fear held by the one in pain. 

However, we would caution one against simply abandoning the friend to his or her pain for this is not the role of the friend relative to the one so pained. It is their duty and role to choose how to relate to the pain at all times, and they must make the decision on a change of relating to it; they must make the decision that escape has exhausted its utility. They must reach out for a thought form that can contextualize walking through the darkness to the light, for it must have some meaningfulness and reality in their minds to occur. And furthermore, the physical pain is a corollary of that which occurs more subtly in the emotions and mentations of the one so afflicted.

We offer care in this regard, and we would point to this care as a form of healing, but we provide it much less effectively than you in incarnation. When your friend is in pain and you find it unacceptable to witness this, you have an alternative of sorts. You may open your heart to the pain and feel along with your friend. You have this within your co-Creatorship: to share any kind of pain if you are soft and porous enough and courageous enough to do so, to let it pierce you and thereby to offer camaraderie and solidarity to your friend. This does work with the resistance to pain for the loneliness that pain creates in the sufferer—the inability to relate it to others in such a way that others will continue to offer friendship—is deep, is absolutely isolating.

So we encourage you to work against isolation. This, as a matter of fact, is one of the manners in which social memory shall obtain on this planet, we believe, for these pains continue to be generated through the imbalances in the greater social yellow-ray complex you all partake of. When you learn to take on, in some small way, the pain of others, you are redistributing it. You are acknowledging its purpose and goodness in a way, and allowing for the one in more pain to feel into a meaning in it that is not solely about its own distorted concept of self. You are reflecting a new possibility that can inspire one to go through the pain to the light. 

We are not saying that you can heal them this way because, as you well know, only the self can heal the self, but the self can heal the self on behalf of another self in part. By this we mean: what the pain reflects in the friend can be embraced as an example, as a thought form of possible alternative relating. We offer no guidance on how to get there, for every relationship is different, and it must be honestly encountered to be of any value. Look to the one known as Jesus in your sacred texts. Every healing was accompanied by a frank and personally vulnerable feeling. The one known as Jesus put himself on the line, and it is this willingness to hurt that gives the courage to the other to go through their hurt. 

Now, in closing on this topic, we would provide some remarks on the palliatives that your world offers, the harsh chemical compounds that fight distortion with distortion, shall we say. There is a place for them but it is not well understood in your culture. This has to do with matters that go far beyond bodily health and into the roots of the catalysts that are experienced as ill health and pain in the body, the closing off and numbing of the senses rather than the careful attending to them such that information can be transmitted. You see, there is a sacred element to pain that simply builds up to a toxic level because of your society's emphasis on one side of the pole, always being happy and looking without for the reasons why one cannot be content. This is a very crude encapsulation of a complex phenomenon with many facets. So please do not take this as authoritative in a summary way but instead as one offering of analysis. For we of Latuii can only offer what we have and what we think will be useful, and anything in excess of this would not fit into words.

The reciprocal phenomenon of this imbalance towards a feeling that happiness should obtain at all times, and that the inability of this affect to constantly be present is some kind of problem, is the desire to escape, to blot out the experiences with the senses being only the lowest level of this greater philosophical and psychic imbalance, and those brothers and sisters of Monka spoke on this a bit at your last channeling gathering.3 They wished you to keep a firm grasp on the full spectrum of feeling that tuning to the planet can confer. This is good advice, even if it feels very unapproachable right now, because to strive towards this will provide the context for imagining a way of dealing with your planet's issues other than escape, other than fighting and attacking. 

There is another mode available: the ability to shift the modality of thought and vibration such that one becomes the balance in a given situation. This is the crude purpose with which your kind invoke the drug: to change the self to address the detuned condition. We offer simply that you need not look without for the mechanism here; that you can look within to find these different aspects of self that you can bring to bear once you are listening to the key the song is played in (to use their metaphor.) 

We do not suggest that you never use a substance, for you are drenched in them, and that would be also a kind of escape, would it not? You must learn how to be a self in many different modes, many different situations, while keeping the thread of what is at the root of you fresh and vibrant in your mind and in your heart. This is the manner towards which we would direct your circle, for this begins to work with the spirit complex to bring in these completely out of band possibilities that train the imagination—that train it, my brothers and sisters—to achieve new heights of co-Creatorship, and this will be the most effective way in which the pain that some feel intensely can be shared, so that no one feels it overwhelmingly. You must be very deft and listen closely for the service that is requested underneath the words used, and this will take you on a journey that you will recognize as that of the adept, for it is a tall order in your society. 

We encourage you—we do not advise you, but we encourage you—to consider it, and to consider how uniquely you may walk this path, looking to nobody as a requirement, not waiting on others to give you permission. It is in a way a revolutionary act on behalf of your fellow other selves, and it is so revolutionary that it is entirely peaceful, for you find within yourself that quality of power that emerges when one truly embraces love and light. And in this respect, you have a complete message that we of Latuii may offer you. 

We are so pleased to have had this opportunity to commune with your circle. May we answer any follow-up questions from you today, my brothers and sisters. 

Max: I have a question. Is there a way that we can productively work with thought forms in regards to pain and addiction, whether they be more self-destructive thought forms tied to longing for comfort, or maybe empowering thought forms? Just if you could shed any light on that. 

We are those of Latuii. We believe we get the gist of your question, and it is a doozy, shall we say. 

The first skill we would hint at—and we caution you, my brother, we cannot explicate in full through this instrument, or any instrument, for the true understanding involved here must come from within—the first step is to be able to recognize and prune thoughts that you find lacking in usefulness. When you find yourself inundated by despair and pain and the trapped feeling, you are experiencing something that is for you real. What you may not appreciate is the way that you contributed to that feeling through your thinking. 

Our brothers and sisters of Hatonn have often spoken of the careful curation of the mind.4 This seems to many to entail a kind of rigid control, but this is not what we mean. You may think any thought you wish. The problem only lies in the lack of complete engagement with the full consequences of the thought, for thoughts that do not serve you will be followed through to their inherent ends if you give them the opportunity. This is the correct use of the mind: to actually test these forms, the way that they feel, the child thoughts they spawn, and the thoughts that they crowd out. The only tool we would suggest, short of group work, would be the full exploration of each and every thought, for once you have made this discovery, you will naturally avoid and cease giving energy to that which does not serve you. 

It is the lack of effort that is concomitant with the poor attention span, shall we say, of your peoples that is at issue here. Once you are able to let unhelpful thoughts run themselves out, so to speak, by not feeding them, you will be in a position to feed those thoughts that are helpful, for they will be able to disclose their full nature to you, they will be able to read the entire story of themselves to you. And you can start to collect those helpful thoughts into structures of thought that then provide the scaffolding for this new version of the self that pain, suffering, and woe are designed to impel you towards. 

Have we made an answer to your question, my brother? 

Max: Yeah, that was great. Thank you. 

We thank you. We are those of Latuiii. May we answer any other questions or respond to a comment you may have? 

William: Latuii, I find myself musing about how to choose objects of meditation to allow for playfulness even with heavy matters. Is there anything along these lines you would like to comment on? 

We are those of Latuii, and you have called the right number, my brother, for we are constantly in celebration of the lightening, humorous manner of relating to this absurd creation, this beautiful creation, and this sad creation, for they all form the actual experience of self-awareness.

It is incumbent upon you as an offerer of thought forms in this mode to recognize the nature of the offering. You cannot ever be certain that the service call you hear is being answered by the service you have within yourself to offer. This is always a kind of gamble, and it must be prosecuted with a heavy dose of humility. 

Keep your lightness by touching each form in your mind with a feather, so to speak. These offerings are not themselves the service. The intention, my brother: the intention is the service, and it flows from your heart first and then achieves shape and coherence through your godly mind. Learn to feel what you wish to offer first, and then let it show you its projection into the illusion. Follow this as you would follow an old trail, hundreds of years old, covered with leaves and growth, but still whispering its nature to you. And then, as you follow it, feel it, and let this intercourse, this interchange between feeling and thought, this feedback loop, we might say, guide you. 

When you have made the offering, there is another feedback loop to cast your attention towards: the feedback of the other self. You must learn to honestly offer and honestly accept the success or failure of the offering. We assure you, my brother: whatever you offer in love is not a mistake, and what another may reject is not a ruling on its fitness, but only the same free will that you have embraced located in the other self. It is a risk, but all that is valuable arises therefrom. 

May we elaborate in some way, my brother. 

William: I feel content with what you have said. Thank you. 

Then if you are content, my brother, we of Latuii are content, and we would ask this instrument to make a closing at this moment and to convey our deep appreciation to your circle for this initial friendly confluence. We have enjoyed it, my brothers and sisters, and bid you a fond farewell. 

I am Latuii. Adonai vasu. Adonai vasu borragus. ☥

1. Hatonn via Weiland: August 15, 2025

2. Ra via Rueckert: Session 85, Question 16

3. Monka via Weiland: July 19, 2025

4. For one example among many, see Hatonn via Rueckert: March 1, 1972
item.excerpt:encoded: Latuii is a fifth density social memory complex, typically a constituent of the Q'uo principle and before then in frequent contact with L/L Research. They speak on the subject of pain, especially bodily pain, and the ways to which it might be related on the seeker's path, both as recipient and as witness of another's pain. They suggest the most efficient use of pain involves feeling it deeply, and they encourage the friends of the afflicted to open themselves as well to this pain and provide company for the journey. Commentary is also provided on drugs, working with addiction and pain through thought forms, and offering ideas for meditation with a playfulness that will be recognized by the other self.

item.title: Auxhall on Thought Forms and Service
item.dc:creator: jeremy
item.content:encoded:
Introduction

Closing out the 2025 Invitational event, Auxhall visits the circle to invite contemplation on the nature of thought forms and our role as creators within the cosmic hierarchy. Auxhall emphasizes the distinction between our own conscious agency and the more passive existence of thought forms which lack will and are shaped by our intentions. Thoughts are not merely ex nihilo creations but the means by which we release latent potential within infinity, a faculty only entities in the logoic chain possess. The message also touches upon the importance of focusing on love and service rather than seeking control or wisdom and the power of faith in navigating our third density existence, specifically addressing how service-to-self forces might be confronted.

Group question

What is the relationship and distinction between thought forms and mind/body/spirit complexes? How do they relate to conscious service? 

Channeled message

(Jeremy channeling)

We are those of Auxhall, and we are with this instrument at this time. We greet you merrily in the radiant love and effervescent light of our One Infinite Creator who bestows upon all of us the magnificent consciousness that allows us to relate one to another as mirrors of Its divine radiance. We are pleased to make contact once more with your circle for it has been a few rounds, has it not, since our last visit. This is of no concern because you have focused your love to such a degree that the challenge issued by this instrument has cooperated with our challenge to bring only what is helpful and can be transmitted to you with profit and love.

This intercourse between those of your kind and those of our kind, therefore, is not simply a parlor trick, shall we say, but instead draws upon seeking. We may seek at different rungs on the ladder, but our positions are connected and we know when we reach back our hand to you, we reach our hand to ourselves, and when we reach our hand up, we reach to ourselves. Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, all that is required for this transmission to effect a positive experience is honesty on all parts and a faithfulness to the Creator's will and purpose.

Thank you for exercising discrimination this evening. We know this is a perennial request that you must grow weary of from time to time; we know this instrument does. However he also recognizes, as we are sure you do, how crucial free will is to the path you seek to tread; that we not in any way manipulate or subtly influence you to do what we would, but only to call to the Creator within you and have you channel from that inner source Its will, Its love, Its purposes, and that, my friends, is a task we cannot perform for you, nor would we. Please dispense with any of our comments that you do not agree with, that you do not feel right, that seem off in any way, and this need not be a decision you make at this moment. You may listen or read back and make your decision then. For now, let us bask in our Creator's love and light. Let us commune together and let us run our fingers over the sacred text of the Word that is our Creator in manifestation.

We pause to deepen our contact with your circle.

(Brief pause)

I am Auxhall. Thank you.

Now this evening, you have investigated the term, "thought form," and you present us with several aspects of inquiry into this that we find our complex is suited to address. You ask, firstly, what is the relationship between a being such as yourself and a being that you might identify as that of a thought form? For you have given us a working definition that we are not eager to expand or complexify to a very great degree. You have a concept of the thought form that works for you, and this is adequate for us to serve you. The distinctions between what you are and what a thought form is are rather elementary to enumerate.

To begin with, it is true, as the one known as Edgar once stated, that mind is builder.1 Mind is the substrate of the Creator's entry into illusion for the purposes of self-discovery in its multifaceted, fractally organized approach. This is important to realize at the get-go, so to speak, because you articulate at this moment complexes in excess of mind.

Now it is true that there is the relationship there between body and mind and spirit and mind, and this instrument's articulation of the convenient ways to distinguish them has flaws to it, we would admit. And we are limited in our message by the flaws in this model; but my friends, if this were the end of the story, how would one ever approach unity and perfection? There must be some continuity between distortion and that which was distorted, otherwise no recognition could occur. And in this matter, those of your circle have spoken quite well that this chain, this genealogy of distortions, speaks to the goodness of creation, the redemption of separation, and the all-encompassing majesty of our One Infinite Creator.

So to return to the subject, we begin with mind, for thought forms occur in this complex: the mind complex. As you know, this complex is so named because it consists of several parts working in tandem to effect the faculty of mentation that makes manifestation and yielding to the wind of spirit possible—nay, inevitable. So your experience of thought forms will be different than ours simply for one reason that is quite colloquial to your experience, and that is that you do not have direct access, easy access, to the unconscious portions of this complex.

This will create a situation in which what we describe about the difference between you as a thought creator and the thought form as a created thought will persist somewhat as an unbalanced equation, and we ask your forgiveness for this incompleteness. As our brothers and sisters of Oorkas have intimated,2 where words fail, the vibration behind words can help if one can learn the skill of feeling into messages to touch their center rather than critiquing their outer character for the paradoxes and inconsistencies that will always obtain through the distortion of language. With this caveat offered, we believe you have seen the first distinction and the first relation between form of thought and generator of thought.

Now, are you not generated as a being somewhat? Yes and no. It is not true that you are a thought form in totality. However, there is some truth to the idea that the complexes of which you partake, be they your own individual complex of mind, body, and spirit complexes, the complex you form as a circle or as a culture or nation or what have you, partake of this genesis. You create structures that give you articulable avenues into the plenum of potential, and it is your thought structures that call to the activation of potentials, for all of these possibilities exist in simultaneity. And one of the features of the mind complex is its ability to bring what is in potentiation into actuality. You call this "creation," and we do as well, but it is somewhat of a misnomer since it really consists more of a choice of experience of that which already is. The aspect of time plays a role here, for it is the change that time mediates that creates the possibility for the shift between potential and actuality.

Now we have given you some more precise ways to (no pun intended) think about thought. For you are inclined to consider your thoughts as coming out of thin air, so to speak, and this is not the case. You simply as a mind complex, let us say, have the ability to direct your little portion of the first distortion of our Creator to the magnification in time, in awareness, of a given sector of this thought edifice. When we use the word "edifice," what we mean is a kind of pre-existing plenum of potential that exists most primarily as thought.

Thought forms cannot do this. They are capable of action upon other thoughts, to be sure, for this is the basis of their ability to trickle down into manifestation, and if they had not this capability, you would hardly recognize them as a character in the play whatsoever. But they have no will, my friends, save that imbued in them by an entity such as yourself.

And let us put a fine point on it: you occupy a link in the logoic chain, and this is what is crucial. The logos is the portion of creation that acts upon creation to direct the Creator's investigation of itself in a manner that we describe in the Confederation as intelligent. What are the aspects of this intelligence? What are its qualities so that you may see the distinctions and the relations between these two categories of creation? 

Well, first: the ability to participate in the patterning of the creation. We do not say, "author the patterning," though in some cases your creativity as a feature of your logoic patrimony does involve the deep actuation of potential in a way that seems to you in front of the veil as pure creation. We quibble not with the word for it simply reflects one facet of an experience that you cannot appreciate in total in your present conscious state. 

Secondly, you have the ability to blend not simply with thoughts, but with other mind/body/spirit complexes—indeed, with complexes of a variety of descriptions. This is how you are able, for example, to invest your second density friends with opportunities to actuate the spirit complex and the donning of the reflective nature of awareness that allows for pattern recognition beyond reactions and instincts. This is one example. 

Another is that which our brothers and sisters of Hatonn mentioned previously: when a circle such as yours takes careful time to intentionally blend their will, their seeking, and their energies.3 Thought forms don't do this, you see. They are kinds of patterns set in motion by those occupying a place in the logoic beingness of the creation. This is more clearly articulated in archetypal study, my friends, where you can see Matrix of Mind as the actor and Potentiator of same as that which is acted upon. This is a dichotomy whose true import and value is not in the Dinge an sich themselves, but instead in the space between them as those of Hatonn offered. For there you see the dynamism at play, and this is a clue as to why those of Ra encouraged the comparison of archetypal stations one to another to learn of their nature, for to know what is is in part to discover what is not, and there is much mystery here that discloses the Creator's nature to the careful and judicious seeker.4

For that matter, thought forms do not seek except in the crudest and most shallow manner, for their intentionality, so to speak, is very attenuated because thought has an inherent nature independent of the reason of its generation, its cultivation of potential, and its instrumental purpose as constituent of the overall will—or at least a higher stratum of will. You may appreciate that this involves that very reflexive character of mind we spoke of earlier. There is no reflexivity in a thought form. Now, there is no reflexivity in the mind complex either, except to the extent that you and your mind complex are not the same thing.

This is why we use the word, "complex," for it allows us to speak of a portion of this logoic beingness that is greater than the sum of the complex elements, so to speak. If there is paradox here, it is the paradox of separation. For as logos, sub-logos, sub-sub-logos, you partake of the Creator's desire for unity and awareness directly—distortedly, no doubt, but remember what has been mentioned previously. Distortion is not pejorative. It is inherent in the inevitability of reunification. For that which can be distorted, diluted, modified has within it that which can be recognized back to the source. And on the service-to-others path, this tracing, this pulling of the thread of love through the chain of distortions comprises your genealogical origin.

So, there you have it: our explication such as can be conveyed through this meager instrument of such a broad subject as you have inquired about. Now that you are aware of your place in the hierarchy of the creation, what shall you do with this—you as Creator, you as co-Creator, and you as created? How may you employ thought in its form, its potency over some period of time such that you may serve?

Well, this will retrace previously conveyed information from our brothers and sisters of Latuii.4 For they spoke, did they not, of the manner in which negative ideas and thought forms might be pruned. In truth, this is the task of the entity exercising the polarized choice. For when the thoughts that bind you to the illusion, especially those that are deeply embedded in your incarnate experience, are starved out, shall we say, through denying them the fertilizer of your attention, what is left is quite positive, quite creative, quite effusively generous even. You are on a planet on which the predominant thought forms, despite your experience, are positive. This is why your assembly into social memory is at hand and the negativity you experience is but the final testing of your true desire.

As our brothers and sisters of Monka conveyed previously, the time of sublimated negativity into the planet, the subconscious of the social memory complex, is over.5 And what you deal with now is quite plain before your face. What you see is what you get, and it will not even last too terribly much longer, one way or another, my friends. If there were the opportunity to shift this planet's polarity, it would have happened long ago, for the tools and the potential were there. And now, as those of Ra have previously offered, all that is left to exploit by service-to-self entities is that quiet horror they spoke of.6

So your task, in order to serve on the side of the light, is to work on your own distortions, which have in many cases their ground in the thought form, the patterns of approaching experience you learned, not discarnately but in your lifetime, in the last couple of dozen years. We know describing it this way will not make the challenge seem less. As much as we might wish to encourage you in the agency you have in the mind, we are not here to persuade you. We simply lay the map in front of you. We don't even point at a location, for you, like us, are in the logoic chain, and your will will be done as the Creator's will, one way or another: in error, in deceit, or in pure honesty and magnanimity. Either way, you will learn and you will grow.

So if you can conceive of service as a matter of setting the right intentions, as this instrument mentioned earlier, you have a kind of scale with which to weigh each discrete thought form you are able to identify, and therefore the work becomes more an issue of inventorying the conscious mind for that which feeds this intention and prosecutes your mission as servants of the Creator and those which pull you into the dark—but sometimes more comfortable—sinkhole of indifference. You need not fight the negative. As the one known as Dion verily and truthfully related, it is merely a matter of not giving it your imprimatur, so to speak; of letting the negativity spin itself out.7 For to fight is to offer it fuel; to oppose is to make it more concrete than it need be, if indeed this is an illusion and if indeed you have faith in the reality behind that illusion. There are complex and erudite forms of magic and thought that employ these forms to great effect. But we would not offer these to you, for at this late hour, the train is in motion, the boulder is rolling down the hill, you need only step a little bit further aside as you ascend.

We hope that this helps you use your faculties as a sub-sub-logos to the best ends such that you may realize the Creator in your life and you may learn to listen to your true self so that more and more, regardless of the chaos around you, service becomes an act of love instead of one of desperate defense. This is the way of wisdom that we of Auxhall are able to share with you that can have some place in a third density life. Of course there is more to say, but we would now listen to your comments, questions, and find how to speak to your heart at this time.

We are those of Auxhall. Are there any remarks to be shared with us at this time?

Max: You spoke briefly on investiture in second density companions. I was wondering if the rapid phenotype changes in second density companions were due to higher density energies and if there's a similar effect across all densities, like fourth density energy integrated, doing something like phenotype changes.

We are those of Auxhall, and we are aware of your query, my brother. We are following your train of thought, and there is some sliver of truth to the way you are approaching this, but it is not as concrete as you have laid out.

Rapid phenotype changes are an element of second density nature on this planet. Now, other planets have different manners of evolutionary transmission of information across the generational divides, and their periodicity is again different. We would not invest, so to speak, a great deal of import in how investiture affects the physical characteristics of the second density entity. This is simply not as important, we would suggest.

What is important in investiture is the slow emergence of the reflective nature of mind that we spoke of earlier; as the one known as Nona related,8 to catch a pale reflection of the Creator in the mind such that the upward spiraling light is not simply instinctually pursued, but begins to allow—it demands in fact—the direct participation of the mind/body complex in the evolutionary structures of the universe itself, beginning with the third density experience of achieving polarization.

Phenotypes come and phenotypes go, my brother, for there is a great diversity in second density life forms throughout the cosmos, and we simply do not have a great deal to offer when it comes to this more scientistic approach. It is the spirit complex that is the grand prize: a prize you still pursue, for as we explicated with thought forms, the actuation of what is potential is merely a first step. And there is much to follow, as you will shortly discover in your evolutionary path, my brother.

May we speak further to this in any way?

Max: No, I think that's great, thank you.

We are grateful to you for this question. We do not mean to hem in your inquiry, only to offer that which we have to give. I am Auxhall; is there a final query before we depart your circle?

Elliot: You mentioned the concept of letting negativity spin itself out and a practice of (inaudible) as a way of wisdom that could have a place in third density experience. I don't know if I got that right. Could you elaborate on those words for us?

I am Auxhall, and I believe that we have your question correctly understood. Please re-query if we are off the mark, for this answer, as we conceive it now, is very brief.

We only mean to say that, firstly, your great lesson in this density—whether you be wanderer or native—is love, not wisdom; faith, not the levers of control that the patterning of the creation offer to the mind/body/spirit complex. When we give you a hint of what is possible in the mind complex, we do not want to set expectations for you that would detract from the primary pursuit of love in all of its guises.

Secondly, we wish to hem in, so to speak, any misapplication of our words because in spite of the limited command you have over your total complex, you still, my brother, are quite powerful. And with this power comes the possibility of deeper error in the metaphysical world than the physical would allow. Remember the story of Ra, speaking of Carla's potential kidnapping, so to speak, into negative time/space.9 This is an extreme—we underline, boldface and highlight, extreme—example of the kind of thing we are talking about when you tap fully into what you are capable of. For you do not need a driver's license to drive the Lamborghini into the china shop, and your goal is to simply graduate high school, my brother, if you take our meaning, not to become a Formula One driver.

Have we met the query sufficiently for you?

Elliot: Absolutely.

We are so pleased. We are those of Auxhall, and we acknowledge this instrument's fatigue. He wants to "chill" with his friends and not fall asleep on them. We understand, and we feel we have covered a great deal of ground with you.

We feel our message is elementary. But in third density, you do not need to be wizards. You must learn to be servants: servants of your Creator, servants of each other who mirror the Creator back to you. The rest of it comes later. Have faith, my brothers and sisters, for this is your power, and if you realize this faith in incarnation, you wield a power that no discarnate entity can combat or manipulate. Work on your distortions, not because you must be perfect, but because they give you something to apply yourself to, and through this application to learn about our One Infinite Creator. 

I am Auxhall. I leave you now in the love and light of this infinite Creator of ours, thanking you on behalf of the entire confederation for giving us this opportunity this weekend. Adonai vasu borragus. I am Auxhall. ☥

1. According to the blog maintained by the Edgar Cayce-founded Association for Research and Englightenment, this phrase, “Mind is the builder,” appears in 284 of his readings and is typically a reference to the idea that “Spirit is the life, mind is the builder, and the physical is the result.”

2. Oorkas via Weiland: May 24, 2025

3. Hatonn via Weiland: August 15, 2025

4. Ra via Rueckert: Session 88, Question 24

5. Monka via Weiland: July 19, 2025

6. Ra via Rueckert: Session 17, Question 23

7. This is almost certainly a reference to Dion Fortune's The Cosmic Doctrine (Weiser Books, 2000). One might also consult her Psychic Self-Defense (Thorsons, 1977).

8. A reference to the earliest known channeling of Nona:

To be born into the flesh was the beginning of consciousness, of individuality; to grow by the exercise of free will until it became strong enough to catch a pale reflection of the Spirit of God.
- Nona via “Rosemary,"  Ancient Egypt Speaks (Hulme and Wood, 1937)

9. The account of this episode begins with Ra via Rueckert: Session 68, Question 5

.
item.excerpt:encoded: Closing out the 2025 Invitational event, Auxhall visits the circle to invite contemplation on the nature of thought forms and our role as creators within the cosmic hierarchy. Auxhall emphasizes the distinction between our own conscious agency and the more passive existence of thought forms which lack will and are shaped by our intentions. Thoughts are not merely creations but the means by which we release latent potential within infinity, a faculty only entities in the logoic chain possess. The message also touches upon the importance of focusing on love and service rather than seeking control or wisdom and the power of faith in navigating our third density existence, specifically addressing how service-to-self forces might be confronted.

item.title: Q'uo on Crossing the Threshold Into the New
item.dc:creator: jeremy
item.content:encoded:
Introduction

The Q'uo principle addresses the Richmond circle members' concerns about letting go of old situations and stepping into new, unknown ones. Highlighting the archetypal nature of these transitions, Q'uo connects thought forms to the less discrete matters of faith and causality to shed light on the nature of the meandering path each seeker walks. Follow-up questions tackle issues of accepting the self, offering service while suffering from personal handicaps, and the nature of cooperation within the Confederation.

Group question

Today, Confederation entities, we ask: how do we relate to being on the threshold of transformation, where we let go of old patterns and conditions and make space for new patterns and conditions? How does cooperation with our friends in a group help us maintain a stability through change?

Channeled message

(Jeremy channeling)

I am Q'uo. Greetings, my brothers and sisters, in the love and light that circles around us and around you, those elements of our One Infinite Creator whose depth and profundity we celebrate this day with your circle. We are very pleased to once again bring our vibration, synthesizing several Confederation complexes.

We realize this instrument wishes to practice the gift of discernment across vibrations. My brother, can you practice this within our band, learning to catch the odor of those of Monka, or those of other, less distinct complexes? The name that comes to mind startles you, and yet: go with it. For you are, in our vibration, blending with many, and in this way your circle inducts your fellow humans into the blending that is the Confederation.1 As you share and commiserate with each other, you realize that even the struggles are limned with joy, and in the sharing you offer the planet—and the Creator, by extension—ingress into the illusion, the mirror that the Original Thought has proposed might yield insight. 

As we begin our message, let us (as usual) caution those who shall consume our message to use their utmost discernment. It is in this discernment, this careful seating of the words and thoughts we bring to bear, that you serve as our partners. For the diction and chosen sound vibratory complexes we select through—and in tandem with—this instrument are but a means: a means to an end that you ground and by which you bless your friends and family, your acquaintances, and the strangers who encounter you. 

It seems like sometimes all of the arrangements to bring a working such as this into a state of fruition must be done in “just so” a way. And this is helpful to the extent that it frees your hearts to dream a common dream with the Creator in each element you sense in this working. When, however, the arrangements and limitations become confining and uncomfortable, you may release the stricture, as our brothers and sisters of Ra have coined this phrase.2 You may riff and step outside the limitations of the sheet music. Your solo, even in tension and dissonance, may yet, in spite of everything the emotional body brings to bear as a sense, may yet lead back to oneness, may find its way to the root note, and with faith that harmony will be the product of diligently listening and following the band off track, so to speak. You may unleash the creativity that each of you bring to this session, that yearning and calling that brings about a new side of the seeker's path. 

With this convoluted disclaimer, we demonstrate precisely what we mean, and setting aside our warning, we would segue into the topic which involves these moments of crossing the threshold from the known but worn out and depleted portion of experience to make that room for what is new, what is in potential and being activated by your seeking and calling. If we seem to trivialize this, you have our apologies for, with no portions of ourselves so kept in the dark as the veil affords you in your awareness, we encounter transformation as a constant, continuous melody. Knowing ourselves, knowing our vibration means we can follow this path wherever it may lead us without losing our way or losing ourselves. 

Now this fear that you may feel, this trepidation that attends the crossing of the threshold such that you release what has been: because of this veil, you do not see the plan, its enumerated steps strewn out across the page. You cannot simply read ahead or go back with perfect recollection to comfort yourself with the goodness of where you have been led in the past and ended up. 

We would pause for just a moment to point out: though you have woes and sorrows and fears, my siblings, are you not safe at this moment? Are you not wrapped in security and protection and warmth and love? Those of Hatonn once said, commenting upon that prayer Jesus shared with his followers, an interpretation of the line, “give us this day our daily bread,”3 and they commented thusly: you are not entitled to a risk-free certainty of the future when it comes to your ability to sustain yourselves, be that financially, emotionally, as a matter of identity. This day you ask for what you need; this day, not any other. And if you can take your faith from the recognition that there is, in truth, only one moment, and there is, in truth, one place on the path, then you will know with solid certainty that the possibilities for ruin and sorrow are not a part of your awareness except to the extent that you invoke them, for now—right now—you breathe the air, the atmosphere of your Mother Earth, who has provided you a nesting place on her bosom, and you are secure insofar as you have a heartbeat and an awareness now. 

What we mean to say, my brothers and sisters, is that the threshold is illusory and only offers a lesson should you wish it. Now, you do wish it; each of you has spoken of the apprehension of moving into the new. This is the feeling tone that is a portion—a very important piece—of the archetypal experience of third density, namely: the Matrix of the Mind, known to many on your planet who have opened to the more subtle experiences available as “The Magician.” Why is it on your planet you have located this base state of mind—the clearing out of the old to make an empty container into which you may pour yourself and pour the Creator's elixir of life—synonymous with that of the Magician, the arms at the ready, the sphere of power and creativity held aloft so that the eye may begin to see what it will see?

My friends, what we are attempting to express is how magical, how creative, how teeming with potential the next step you take is. It calls to you and draws you in its inscrutable pregnancy of enlightenment and discovery. It is irresistible to that spark within you that remains despite any choices or degradations you entertain, a piece of the Logos carefully placed within your heart; within the heart, my brothers and sisters, not the brain. It is your task and goodsome opportunity to let your heart teach your intellectual, fretting mind that yields to your command and wishes how to love in thought, to not simply express the feeling which is, we confess, quite rapturous and all-encompassing, and in this love you lose yourself, and in losing yourself you have a glimpse of your true nature. 

However, it is then, when you return to the human condition that so frequently you have experienced in those moments when you have paid attention, that you put that feeling, that faithful longing for unity in a vessel of sorts, a container, and we call this container the thought form, the constituted constellation of mental expenditures that has a stability to it and that you may cling to so as to give your project of awareness in this illusion coherence and a continuity. Do not mistake the vessel for the liquid essence. Do not mistake the new experience to come with the experience of being empty. These are distinct in the stations of the wanderer's path, and if you can appreciate each, you have the capability to graduate, my friends, to a more refined synthesis where you dip below the constructs and taste the sea of spirit.

We have described this as something far more seemingly concrete than is experienced by the typical mind/body/spirit complex because our words are a map. They are not the territory, and when we bid you adieu this afternoon and send you on your way, you will be the one who chooses the direction, who chooses which path on the map to follow, and it is your footfalls that will guide you towards your fate. We do not say that this destiny is set in stone, but we also need not confer upon your choices, one by one, an unlimited amount of agency, for they themselves constitute the synthesis of many dynamics within your complex, and in truth we have, through other Confederation emissaries, hinted at the possibilities for a cooperative exploration of the elements involved in this synthesis. 

Now again, though the paradox of free will and determinism is understood by you to be two sides of a coin, the spending of the coin is the thing that registers in awareness, whether you see it as happening to you or you happening to it. It is, as our brother Eric described, a moment in an infinite resonating wave between two mirroring surfaces, and it is through those practices with which your circle deals on a regular basis that this polarity resolves into a unity. In this unity—even of the moment—we bid you to tap in as often as you can, to drink from this well. It need not be you synthesizing water from hydrogen and oxygen every time you are thirsty. This well already exists if you are to truly believe in the infinity of consciousness, and to understand that the thought form is useful, that the container has the purpose of bringing this potential unity to bear in a moment that you are subject to, be it through the figment of your imagined selection, or through the imaginary reception of the environment and the conditions about you. 

It is not a simple thing, my brothers and sisters, to orient the self—to orient the directionality of one's awareness—when cause and effect are so slippery and confused. If it were in every respect up to you, third density would take much, much longer than it currently does. The yellow-ray illusion is your salvation: the social intercourse you enjoy in circles such as this—even in conflict, even in disharmony—teaches the seeker who has eyes to see that together is how the paradox is resolved; together is how we cross the threshold such that we make new our commitments to one another, fresh our friendships and loves. 

It is far too simple for an instrument such as this to convey, far too elementary. And so, we conjure up the visuals, the structures of thought which he may unfurl through his tongue and his vocal cords. Look through that, brothers and sisters; look through it to the depth of feeling underneath, where knowledge is not something that must be remembered and processed, but is a bone-deep resonance, something you cannot escape if you wanted to. 

We trust you are entirely competent: each of you separately and as a circle (even those members who share a more distant relative position to this circle). You are entirely able to assist this planet and each other, for details of life in third density are overwhelming, and this is by design. They are there to make this love, this unity, tractable so that you may grasp the crystal and turn it about, and through your eyes the Creator may know itself. And in this way, you can safely step across the line; in this way, you can reach out your hand to him who is afraid to cross. You can extend your arms to your sister who, having crossed, feels forlorn and empty of all that has guided her to date.

There is a role for each of you as individuals, but you discover it as a circle, as a planet. The distinctions are details; the essence is the prize. Help each other refocus the awareness on that which matters, and you will meet any challenge, any calamity, with confidence and the ability to find the love in the moment that much more surely. 

I am Q’uo. Thank you for allowing this instrument to practice and to take such care with your paths in your own ways that we have this rich tapestry upon which we may point out the little ideas and feelings that are sufficient to guide you and, by extension, your brothers and sisters of this planet. It means so much to us to be in this communion with you. For to be sharing love with one of you and to be sharing love with the entire consolidated planetary entity is to us quite similar; barely worth the distinction. 

May we answer any questions as a follow-up to this topic, or anything else you may have on your mind, my brothers and sisters? We are those of Q’uo.

Max: Q’uo, I have some frustrating experiences with dissociation which I think hampers my love and interpersonal connections, and I'm wondering if that's something I can leave behind a threshold, or if it's something I need to work around to better connect with those around me while living with it. 

I am Q’uo. Thank you for your question, my brother. 

There is nothing wrong with you. Do you think, my brother, that if you did not feel this dissociation, the love within you would be different, that it would be more helpful, or service-oriented? What you seek is comfort in knowing that you are well. If we could give you this comfort, we would, for it is the truth. There is absolutely nothing stopping you from serving in a way that would set an example on this planet for all who seek, and all who wander from their planet to serve the birth of a new complex. 

When you learn to accept yourself better, my brother, you will know the truth of our words in that total way that you cannot know now. That is your threshold to cross, and it will be, perhaps, not as discrete a line as you might wish. However, you are not alone: your circle that you cherish so has set for you an example of opening, opening deeply not simply to things that happen to arrangements within the yellow-ray complex but also those matters of the heart that cut through the nonsense—that cut through it so that the deep root gold may be seen. And in being detected so, faith to withstand the difficulties of having a personality are manageable. 

Each here has those elements of self they reject. None in this circle have fully accepted the self. You are no different, and your potential is no different than theirs. We appreciate, my brother Max, that you seek to be diligent in a pure way, and this is a stage on the path. There is a moment in which one has given all one can to expand the container, and one must accept in the moment those limitations that the self and the Creator have imposed. This is why our brothers and sisters of Ra spoke so wisely not of generating love—not of bringing it into some sort of new and fancy display—but of finding it.4 It is already there. It is your task to use its seeming absence as a beacon, for if it seems not to be there, all one must do is exert oneself a little more in the discovery of the true self, the embrace of the self and the other. 

What you pose as a dilemma is to us such a blessing. It would be for us worthy of celebration if we had our future distortions so clearly called out as you do. The path of the seeker is not one of comfort, so we end this response by simply reiterating that you must look for deeper emotional states than feeling ease with others in the moment. You must tap into a deeper love, and in fact you have created these blockages for just this purpose. 

You are so close to realizing how kind you have been to yourself, how in partnership with your brothers and sisters, your role lies before you, begging and waiting for you to discover it. And yet, there is patience. We do not seek to disclose the meaning of the entire puzzle to you, but we do want you to consider a different relationship to that which you have decided is a problem. 

May we expand on this in any way, my brother? We are those of Q’uo. 

Max: Thank you. We'll leave it there. 

Very well, my brother. Are there other questions or concerns that we may address? We are those of Q’uo. 

Max: Can you tell us about the cooperation within the Confederation and the hierarchy that it's based on? 

Certainly, my brother. We are those of Q’uo, and we will be using those of Monka as our shepherd through this query, as they are for this locale of the Confederation the experts, shall we say, on the social confluence that creates the complex of love and single-pointedness. 

In each of these social memory complexes who have a membership relationship with this thought form known as the Confederation of Planets In Service to the One Infinite Creator there is a shared principle. This principle is difficult to enunciate in your language, for you have a language suited to the third density project, and we have very few members who are third density at the planetary level. It is something like... 

We give this instrument an image of a pyramid of cheerleaders. At the very top is honor and glory, and yet a wobble here, a misplaced step there, anywhere below that top-most position, and the entire thing collapses. On the path of service-to-self, this collapse is the norm., and it is through superior ability to invoke energy and force that the pyramid is rebuilt. 

On our side of the poles, we simply revel in the ability of each of us to hold our brother and sister in careful support, with love and a real sense of accomplishment through their accomplishments. When those of Hatonn step aside in their service to this planet, there is no sense of loss or failure. They have the firm certainty that they are backed up by other planets who see what they do not, and in this sense it is as if they see without the apperception that would comfort them. Much as a cell in your body does not know how its nutrients will be provided, it nevertheless does its task and is taken care of. 

Once individuality has achieved its apex of potential through polarization, the levels of hierarchical organization towards the shared principle are endless, and it becomes merely a matter of bringing into the heart what the mind now, with the veil drawn back, sees clearly. It is, in some ways, the inverse of the third density experience. Here, you must have faith that all is well and put yourselves to the task, but in fourth density and beyond (at least on the service-to-others path) it is almost as if the faith is the given, and it is the search for the task that becomes the true goal, the true struggle. 

This is made much, much easier when the cosmic distances you enjoy are collapsed through the progressive encounter with unity that the higher densities offer the seeker. One sees one's true self in the brother and sister, and therefore the accomplishments of one are the accomplishments of all. And the accomplishments of all, in some ways much more poignantly, are the individual accomplishment. You must stretch a bit to understand this in the concrete terms of your society, but this is your future as a planet, and we hope that these thoughts have formed an answer in your mind and heart so that you may put yourself that much more diligently to the acceptance of the self, for the planet depends on it, my brother. 

May we offer any other guidance on this matter? We are those of Q’uo. 

Max: Maybe could you speak briefly on accepting the self? Or actually, oh, leave it be. 

Do you not see, my brother, that you have answered your own question? Leave it be. We are those of Q’uo. We encourage you to consider a state of affairs within your mind/body/spirit complex in which that which you struggle with, you simply cease. 

There is much the experience of being in distress teaches that your friends in the third density illusion cannot. We ask you to sit with that inner struggle and to loosen the grip slowly over time rather than simply thinking that, in each and every case of advancement on the path, the flash of light will reveal all. This, my brother, this enlightenment is in your future and, in truth, deeply ensconced in your past. 

You will not think this realization into awareness. You must feel it, and in this, reach out to your brothers and sisters in this circle. Let them help you. What is to be lost? What is to be risked that is truly precious on the seeker’s path? 

We are Q’uo. We are now at the end of our messages to you. It has been so helpful to us to see in detail what you labor on. These details confound and distract you; to us, they are the adornments on your majesty. They fascinate us as only the drama of third density can fascinate those who have graduated from it. And you, many of you know this well. 

So, with a wave, we bid you adieu and take our leave of the circle in love and in light. I am Q’uo. Adonai vasu borragus. ☥

1. The instrument felt the name of another complex he recognized, but it was a name of a complex he had never encountered before and this confused him. He asked to move on and Q'uo obliged.

2. Ra via Rueckert: Session 10, Question 14 and Session 61, Question 9

3. Hatonn via Rueckert: July 27, 1980

4. This turn of phrase Ra frequently uses, “release X from its stricture,” indicates a moment in the interpretation of representational items like archetypal images and myths where they urge e interpreter to overlook a detail unimportant to the meaning of the symbol, myth, image, etc. For examples see these search results from lawofone.info.
item.excerpt:encoded: The Q'uo principle addresses the Richmond circle members' concerns about letting go of old situations and stepping into new, unknown ones. Highlighting the archetypal nature of these transitions, Q'uo connects thought forms to the less discrete matters of faith and causality to shed light on the nature of the meandering path each seeker walks. Follow-up questions tackle issues of accepting the self, offering service while suffering from personal handicaps, and the nature of cooperation within the Confederation.
